translation: They, having enjoyed the vast heaven, enter the world of mortals when their merit is exhausted; thus abiding by the injunctions of the three (Vedas) and desiring objects of desires, they attain to the state of coming and going.
commentary: 9.21 They they? That's him? enjoyed having eaten? Swargalokam heavenworld? Vishalam vast? depleted at the exhaustion of? Punye merit? Martyalokam the world of mortals? enter enter? Evam thus? Trayidharma of the three Vedas? unsurrendered abiding by? Gatagata the state of goind and returning? Kamakamah desiring desires? labhante attain.Commentary When the accumulated merit (the cause of heavenly pleasures) .
